node.title: War on viruses over for Victoria's sentinel chickens after decades of bloody service
node.alt: A woman in a navy shirt is nursing a brown chicken.
node.description: After almost half a century on the front line in the battle against mosquito-borne viruses, the feathery guardians of Robinvale are being re-roosted to start from scratch.
node.content:
["For almost 50 years, flocks of sentinel chickens\u00a0along the Murray River have formed the front line of defence against mosquito-borne viruses.", "Between mid-spring and mid-autumn, blood taken from the 20 birds at Robinvale in Victoria's northwest would be forwarded to a laboratory to be tested for viruses\u00a0including Ross River fever.", "But it was not a quick turnaround.", "\"We'd take their blood from their wing,\u00a0almost like a finger prick as you would have for a diabetes test,\" Swan Hill Rural City Council's authorised officer Emma Wright said.", "It often took a week or more for scientists to identify whether viruses like\u00a0Murray Valley encephalitis or West Nile were present in the samples.", "Now scientists have found a better way.", "Agriculture Victoria microbiologist Peter Mee said results can be known in days by directly testing mosquito samples.", "\"After we've identified what species we have \u2026 we run them through a range of extraction techniques and target viral fragments and really amplify those up,\" he said.", "", "
Peter Mee is part of the team that is\u00a0testing mosquito samples to detect viruses.(ABC News: Peter Healy)
", "
Retirees re-roosted
", "Ms Wright said because the chickens were accustomed to\u00a0being picked up \u2013 even by the local preschool children \u2013 because they were tested so frequently.", "\"They've helped us to feed them and care for them,\" she said of the kids.", "\"And also with the rehoming of our chickens once they've done their duty for that year,.\"", "Three of the most recently retired\u00a0hens \u2013\u00a0Chickaletta, Henny Penny and Tude \u2013 now spend their days\u00a0roaming freely in a Robinvale backyard.", "", "
Chickaletta, Henny Penny and Tude\u00a0were rehomed by a preschooler and his family.(ABC Rural: Kellie Hollingworth)
", "Victoria's health department said there were 808 notifications for Ross River Virus in 2021.", "The greatest risk is in rural and regional areas, including many coastal holiday areas.", "\"With this rain that's been occurring of recent months, We assume that there is going to be quite a few mosquitoes this season,\" Dr\u00a0Mee said."]
